title: Analyzing MOOC Learner Diversity and Designing Language Blended Learning Strategies: Integrated Grammar, Vocabulary, and Communication Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience, secondary-level language education knowledge (grammar, vocabulary, foundational reading comprehension, writing structures), and understanding of diverse learner types (language learning styles, proficiency levels)
context.additional_context: Enhancing customized language education design capabilities for pre-service/in-service teachers, reflecting MOOC learner characteristics (language learning styles, expression levels, reading habits): developing integrated strategies for grammar, vocabulary, and communication.

learning_goals: Explain at least three ways MOOC learner diversity factors (age, motivation, learning goals) influence language acquisition processes (grammar internalization, vocabulary expansion, communicative competence).

Design at least two customized language teaching strategies for blended learning environments based on learner types (grammar/vocabulary reinforcement, communication-focused, reading-integrated activities).
Develop a mobile microlearning-based language education project (learner motivation analysis, text-type preference report, customized writing feedback system).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
